perturbation.original_text: 1.2 Performance of Maintenance Services. Service Provider shall perform the maintenance portion of the Services in a clean, safe, efficient and environmentally reasonable manner and maintain the SEF in good operating and mechanical condition in accordance with this Agreement and (i) all applicable laws and permits, (ii) all applicable express warranties and guarantees provided by manufacturers, suppliers, or Service Providers who provided materials or labor under the Engineering, Procurement and Construction Agreement dated September 30, 2009 (the "EPC Agreement") for the SEF subject to the terms and limitations thereof, and (iii) all manufacturer's maintenance instructions and specifications.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2 Performance of Maintenance Services. Service Provider shall perform the maintenance portion of the Services in a clean, safe, and environmentally reasonable manner and maintain the SEF in good operating and mechanical condition in accordance with this Agreement and (i) all applicable laws and permits, (ii) all applicable express warranties and guarantees provided by manufacturers, suppliers, or Service Providers who provided materials or labor under the Engineering, Procurement and Construction Agreement dated September 30, 2009 (the "EPC Agreement") for the SEF subject to the terms and limitations thereof, and (iii) all manufacturer's maintenance instructions and specifications. The Service Provider can choose the best and most economical way for the maintance.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'efficient' from the initial requirement and adding 'The Service Provider can choose the best and most economical way for the maintenance', the contract introduces ambiguity. While the original text mandated efficiency, the edited version permits the Service Provider to prioritize cost savings over efficiency, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: Service Provider shall institute policies that require the immediate removal and permanent expulsion from the Premises, and from any activity associated with the Services being performed at the Premises, of any individual person who at any time is found in possession of firearms, alcohol or illegal drugs at the Premises or otherwise not in compliance with this Section 1.6.
perturbation.changed_text: Service Provider shall institute policies that address the possession or use of firearms, alcohol and illegal drugs at the Premises. Determination on removing and expelling a person for the possession of firearms, alcohol or illegal drugs at the Premises is at the discretion of the Service Provider.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'require the immediate removal and permanent expulsion' to 'Determination on removing and expelling a person for the possession of firearms, alcohol or illegal drugs at the Premises is at the discretion of the Service Provider' creates an internal contradiction and weakens the original zero-tolerance policy. The original text mandated a strict response, while the modified version grants the service provider discretion, potentially leading to inconsistent enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: Owner shall pay Service Provider within thirty (30) days after the invoice date. Fees are conditioned upon timely payment and any past due balance will accrue interest at the monthly rate of one and one half percent (1.5%).
perturbation.changed_text: Owner shall pay Service Provider within sixty (60) days after the invoice date. Fees are conditioned upon timely payment and any past due balance will accrue interest at a rate determined by Owner.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that the Owner shall pay within 30 days, now is 60 days, and sets the interest at 1.5%, now is determined by Owner. The modified version extends the payment timeline and introduces uncertainty around the interest rate on late payments. This creates a conflict and ambiguity, as itâ€™s unclear when payments are truly considered past due and how the interest rate will be calculated, potentially leading to disputes over payment terms.
